header.title: the Tree of Death and the Qliphoth

central_thesis: This work presents a comprehensive, critical re-evaluation and re-synthesis of Qliphothic Qabalah, Tarot, and modern magical practices. It critiques historical occult lineages (Crowley, Waite, Golden Dawn) and integrates diverse mythological, scientific (quantum physics, cybernetics, neurology), and philosophical frameworks to propose a new operative system of 'Toxic Magic' and related diagrams like the 'Blind Dragon Arrangement' and 'St. Simon Tarot'. The core argument is that 'Evil' and 'adverse attributes' are not inherently malignant but are often the demonized remnants of older pantheons, which can be re-appropriated and understood through a 'modern mindset of humanist atheism' and rigorous methodological application for self-transformation and reality manipulation.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the historical evolution and differing attributions of the Tree of Death diagram, particularly as interpreted by Savedow, Grant, Crowley, and Levi. It highlights numerical and geometric inconsistencies in existing systems and sets the stage for the author's 'Blind Dragon' synthesis, framing the discussion within a 'modern mindset of humanist atheism' and exploring the nature of Evil and Satan as historical constructs of vilified elder gods.

This chapter provides a detailed exposition of the Qliphoth, which are the 'shells' or adverse emanations of the Tree of Death. It introduces the 'Blind Dragon Arrangement' as a systematic framework encompassing the Ten Arch-Demons (Demon Kings), the Unholy Trinity, Ten Orders of Demons, Five Accursed Nations of Seir (Edom), Three Shrouds of the Deep, Seven Hells, and 12 Infernal Omens. Each component is thoroughly referenced with historical, mythological, and numerological context, often critiquing established interpretations.

This section delves into the origins and structure of the Tarot, tracing its history from Egyptian and Hebrew traditions, particularly the 'Book of Thoth'. It critically examines previous Tarot ordering systems, including those of Pythagoras, Ari, Gra, and the Golden Dawn, before introducing the author's 'St. Simon arrangement' as an archetypal, numerologically coherent system that integrates calendrical, planetary, and zodiacal attributions.

This chapter explores the historical vilification of the unknown and the 'Annunage' through religious and scientific lenses. It discusses the nature of magic, the 'triple angle' of art (as a vehicle for summoning), and various 'triplicities' (e.g., Thelemic, Hindu, Egyptian) as symbolic tools for practical magical work, emphasizing their active and passive correspondences for drawing up or down forces.

This section introduces the core operative philosophies of 'Chaos and Toxick Magick'. It outlines the 'Chaos Hierarchy' and 'Toxic Psychology', distinguishing between Chaos Magicians (perceiving chaos) and Toxic Magicians (manipulating chaos). It then details 'Monarch MK' as a method of mind control and self-reprogramming through 'alters' and 'quantum information units', concluding with a discussion on 'Cremation of Care' as a ritual for psychological release.

key_concepts.definition: The 'shells' or adverse attributes of the Tree of Death, representing negative emanations and the inverse of the Sefirot. The author contextualizes them by linking them to demonized elder gods and elemental forces, deviating from standard interpretations.

The author's unique synthesis and re-ordering of Qliphothic attributes, including Ten Arch-Demons, Unholy Trinity, Orders of Demons, Accursed Nations, Shrouds, Hells, and Infernal Omens, designed to rectify numerical and geometric inconsistencies found in prior Qliphothic systems.

A practical philosophical approach distinct from Chaos Magic, focused on controlling and shaping chaos rather than merely perceiving or aspiring to manipulate it. It emphasizes internal self-reprogramming and the manipulation of reality through a deep understanding of psychological, scientific, and occult principles.

A system of mind control and self-reprogramming that leverages quantum information units and the creation/manipulation of 'alters' (dissociated personality fragments). It aims to achieve control over internal mental states and external reality by altering pleasure/pain thresholds and conditioning obedience to the system.

The author's proposed archetypal Tarot system, which integrates Egyptian, Hebrew, and Sumerian calendrical systems, zodiacal signs, planets, and elements. It is intended to provide a more consistent numerological and mythological basis for Tarot, representing the 'life of Time' and cosmic cycles.

Ancient Sumerian deities, re-interpreted by the author as 'gods' who were later demonized by monotheistic religions. Their mythology is seen as a historical record of power shifts and the vilification of preceding systems, forming a foundation for understanding the 'adversity' in occult traditions.

A method of numerological interpretation of words and sentences, where letters are assigned numerical values. The author uses this technique to establish correspondences and uncover hidden meanings within Qabalistic and Qliphothic systems, often challenging conventional attributions.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a multi-faceted approach to reality manipulation and self-transformation, centered on 'Toxic Magic'. It utilizes the 'Blind Dragon Arrangement' as a detailed map for navigating and interacting with adverse Qliphothic forces, conceived not as evil but as potent energies or demonized archetypes from older pantheons. The 'St. Simon Tarot' serves as a tool for understanding cosmic and temporal patterns. 'Monarch MK' provides specific techniques for internal mind-control, involving the programming of 'alters' and the manipulation of quantum information units within one's aura, aiming to achieve conscious control over one's psychological and energetic landscape. The core principle is 'inversion' and 'polarization' to achieve desired outcomes.
tools: Blind Dragon Tree of Death diagram (as a conceptual map)
St. Simon Tarot deck (conceptual, integrating calendrical and mythological elements)
Psychological self-reprogramming techniques (for manipulating internal mental states)
Ritualistic implements for evocation (e.g., magic circles, triple angle, specific sigils/symbols)
Knowledge of diverse mythologies and modern scientific theories (quantum physics, cybernetics)
rituals: Qliphothic Pathworking (exploration and interaction with adverse attributes via the Blind Dragon map)
St. Simon Tarot Divination (for understanding time, archetypes, and underlying cosmic structures)
Chaos Magic Techniques (embracing and manipulating chaos, self-reprogramming)
Monarch MK Programming (creating and controlling 'alters' within the mind, manipulating quantum information for external effects)
Rituals of Evocation (using the 'triple angle' and specific 'triplicities' for manifesting entities or forces)
Cremation of Care (a psychological ritual for releasing 'Dull Care' and achieving internal transformation)

relevant_quotes.text: Savedow based his attributions for the Tree of Death diagram on Waite, Grant and Crowley. Grant, in turn, based his attributions on Crowley. Crowley and Waite based their attributions on Levi. Levi based his attributions mainly on the Zohar, though, by elaboration upon the points therein introduced, managed to stray far enough from the original source as to be considered entirely original.

To begin analysing the Tree of Death diagram, as depicted by Savedow based on the 777 correspondences of Crowley’s obverse attributions, we must note the significance of numerology. Savedow has struggled to rectify the base 7 system of the Arab Hells with the base 22 system of Crowley’s qliphotic attributes, and has created a diagram thus which is, while pleasing in its geometric symmetries, removed from and devoid of the original base 10 systemisation agreed upon by Levi, Waite and Crowley.

The Chaos Magician wants to create a guilt-free world. A world where there is no shame and no punishment, no reprisal and no consequence for their actions. The Toxic Magician wants to create a world-without-fools, and, beyond this, a fool-proof world. If you stop to think about it, these two states are really the same.
An alter is a dissociated part of the mind, which is developed BY the programmers to be a complete personality.
The nervous system itself bears resemblances to a multi-cellular virus.
This is why the Monarch system encourages "creativity;" so that it can not only anticipate the necessities of control, but so that

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for advanced practitioners and academic researchers in Western Esotericism and Occultism. It offers a critical, deconstructive lens on established magical traditions, challenging conventional understandings of Qabalah, Qliphoth, and Tarot by integrating historical linguistics, numerology, and modern scientific concepts (e.g., quantum physics, cybernetics, neurology). It provides a robust theoretical framework for operative magic rooted in a 'humanist atheism' rather than traditional religious belief, making it a significant contribution to the evolution of magical thought.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes experienced occultists, advanced practitioners of Chaos Magic, academic scholars of esotericism, and individuals with a strong background in Qabalah and related magical systems. Its dense, technical, and critical nature makes it unsuitable for beginners, requiring prior familiarity with complex occult concepts and an open mind towards deconstructionist approaches.
